meanings.definition: A wealthy or influential person, especially in the entertainment industry.
meanings.sent1: The moguls of Hollywood attend glamorous events.
meanings.sent2: The music moguls signed a new artist to their record label.
meanings.sent3: The movie moguls decided to cast a penguin as the lead actor.
meanings.sent4: In the world of entertainment, moguls are the kings and queens.
meanings.sent5: The moguls' influence shapes the direction of the film industry.

meanings.definition: A bump or mound of hard snow on a ski slope.
meanings.sent1: Skiers enjoy navigating the moguls on the slope.
meanings.sent2: The ski instructor taught the students how to ski over moguls.
meanings.sent3: The playful dog jumped over the snow moguls with excitement.
meanings.sent4: The moguls on the slope challenged the skiers' skills.
meanings.sent5: After a snowfall, the moguls on the mountain became more pronounced.

meanings.definition: A type of skiing characterized by quick turns around obstacles.
meanings.sent1: She practiced moguls skiing to improve her agility.
meanings.sent2: Competitors raced through the moguls course with skill and speed.
meanings.sent3: The moguls skiing competition was full of unexpected twists.
meanings.sent4: Navigating the moguls requires precise control and balance.
meanings.sent5: The thrill of moguls skiing is unmatched for adrenaline junkies.
